pageContext.claim: “And as you know, I ended low income housing going into the suburbs, which for men and women living in the suburbs, it's the greatest thing that ever could have happened.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump rescinded federal affordable housing rules, but many states have affordable housing laws of their own that call for an equitable distribution of zoning for low-income housing in otherwise high-income areas. The federal government cannot stop states from enforcing those laws and regulations. Such zoning measures do not affect quality of life in the suburbs, according to decades of research on affordable housing laws and their impact. Such policies tend to benefit minorities and improve social mobility.
